span.style: font-family :sans-serif, Arial, Verdana, \'Trebuchet MS\'; font-size :9pt; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal; text-decoration: none;background-color: ; color: black;

span.strong:
UPDATE: FRIDAY MARCH 27th:
Lakeland Union High School and STAR School/Academy will remain closed for
in-person instruction and extracurricular activities until at least April 24th.
LUHS District schools will be closed on Monday, March 16th through Friday, April 3rd, 2020

td.div: Letter from the District Administrator Rob Way related to extended school closure.

Moving forward (for the next two weeks) we will be tweaking the remote learning schedule to reflect Fridays as student school work catch-up days and teacher grading/preparation days. Please see below for the schedule:

p.b: Students are expected to spend approximately 4 hours per day on school work
Teachers will have lesson plans and student expectations posted for the week by 8 am on Monday morning
Teachers will be available to provide student support, answer questions, and/or deliver lessons via online learning according to the following schedule:

hr.div:
REVISED DISTRIBUTION SCHEDULE: LUHS District will provide bagged breakfast and lunch to students during the school's closure. Beginning Monday, April 6th and continuing through the remaining school closure, any individuals aged 18 years old and younger are eligible to receive a breakfast and lunch with distribution from 11:00 am to 1:00pm ON MONDAYS AND WEDNESDAYS ONLY. Monday's distribution will include Monday and Tuesday's meals, Wednesday's distribution will include Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday's meals. Distribution takes place in between the yellow gates at the Common's glass atrium near the football field. Please do not leave your vehicle - a member of the LUHS Food Service staff will deliver the meals directly to you.
Randy Weitz
Food Service Director
Lakeland Union High School
9573 State Hwy 70 Minocqua, WI 54548
715-356-5252 ext. 3402 (phone)
715-358-8538 (fax)
weitz@lakelandunion.org

td.b: An Article stating what scientist have discovered, so far, about how long COVIC-19 lives in the air and on other surfaces

div.strong: Please see this link for a letter from District Administrator Rob Way >> 3/27/2020 Parent Letter

br.div: Under the 'Safer At Home' order issued by Governor Tony Evers and the state Department of Health Services, LUHS High School and STAR Academy will remain closed for in-person instruction and extracurricular activities until at least April 24th.

i.b: District Administrator and Director of Curriculum & Instruction

li.div: Students are expected to spend approximately 4 hours per day (Monday through Friday) on school work
Teachers will have lesson plans and student expectations posted for the week by 8 am on Monday morning
Teachers will be available to provide student support, answer questions, and/or deliver lessons via online learning according to the following schedule:

div.strong: Chromebook Check out - Monday, March 23rd - 1 pm - 6 pm
div.br:
If you have internet connectivity at your home, and if you indicated on the recent survey that you need a device to work on schoolwork- please stop by LUHS to check out a Chromebook.
Check out will happen at the High School Office entrance on the north side of the building. Parents and students must drive up, stay in their cars, provide staff with their student identification number and student email address to check out a Chromebook that they can take home. When checking out Chromebooks, parents and students must remain inside their cars to maintain social distancing.
Due to the Governor's impending shelter in place order, there is a limited time that we will be able to check out devices. Laptop Checkout will be available today, March 23rd, from 1-6 PM.
Stay safe and be well!

hr.div:
Parents, Families, Students:
Please find below the links for surveys that will provide us information as to how best to serve you moving forward. We NEED as many students as possible to take these surveys before the end of the day on Monday, March 23rd.
Freshman
Sophomores
Juniors
Seniors
(Scroll over your student's class and click the link)
Thank you for completing the survey as this helps us move forward serving our students.

br.p: Greetings LUHS District Staff, Families and Community:

The Situation surrounding COVID-19 is changing rapidly and thus, federal, state, local and District response changes just as quickly. We are increasingly being urged to practice social distancing and observe good hygiene to prevent the spread of the virus.
LUHS District has developed its school closure plan with the health of our students and staff having the highest priority.

li.div: Lakeland Union High School District cancelled all facility usage, practices, games, meetings, and trainings. Our building will be closed until at least Monday, April 6th, 2020. Coaches and/or advisors will not encourage or organize their group assembling to practice or meet physically anywhere.
Planning Day for staff. District staff members will work to share digital learning resources with families
Planning day for staff. Last staff attendance day. District staff members will work to share digital learning resources with families

Lakeland Union School District will provide bagged breakfast and lunch meals to students during the school's closure. Beginning Wednesday, March 18, 2020, from 11:00 am to 1:00 pm, meals for Lakeland Union High School, STAR School, and STAR Academy students will be distributed along the glass atrium to the Commons (located near the football field). Please have your student's name and Student ID number ready and do not leave your vehicle for distribution - a member of the LUHS Food Service staff with deliver the meals directly to you.

br.p: Digital learning resources will be available online. Students should check their google classrooms, teacher websites as well as their school emails. Teachers will be communicating with students.

During this very difficult time, I hope we can work together and continue to look out for each other and for those who are most vulnerable among us. We appreciate your patience and understanding.
Robert M. Way
District Administrator and Director of Curriculum & Instruction

td.a: Letter from Randy Weitz - Food Service Manager

hr.p: Due to the recent coronavirus restrictions and Governor Tony Evers' recommendations, LUHS District schools will be closed on Monday, March 16th through Friday, April 3rd 2020. We will be monitoring the situation closely and will be meeting with officials on Monday March 16th to determine next steps.
Lakeland Union High School & Lakeland STAR Academy
Dear Staff, Parents and Community Members,

As we near the end of spring break the Lakeland Union High School District continues to actively monitor the evolving situation with the coronavirus (COVID-19). We have been in contact with the Oneida County Health Department and continue to receive guidance from the county, state, and federal health departments as the situation continues to develop. The Lakeland Union High School District’s number one priority is the health, safety, and well being of all students. If you or your child has traveled for spring break or for other reasons, the following guidance has been provided to us from the county and state agencies:

li.p: If you have traveled or planning to travel to any international areas visit https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/travelers/after-travel-precautions.html:
If you traveled to a Level 3 Travel Health Notice Country
Stay home for 14 days from the time you left an area with widespread, ongoing community spread (Level 3 Travel Health Notice countries) and practice social distancing.
If you only spent time in an airport in a Level 3 Travel Health Notice Country
At this time, you are not being asked to quarantine yourself if your only time in a Level 3 country was in an airport. However, if you have COVID-19 symptoms, contact your healthcare provider.
If you traveled to a Level 2 Travel Health Notice Country

At this time, individuals are not being asked to quarantine themselves. As a precaution, you should limit your interactions with other people and large groups for 14 days after you return. However, if you have COVID-19 symptoms, contact your healthcare provider.
If you traveled or planning to travel out-of-state:

Place your cursor over the map of the United States of America under “States Reporting Cases of COVID-19 to CDC*”. If the State has a pop-up that states “Sustained Community Transmission: Yes”, then individuals will have to complete a 14-day voluntary self-quarantine.
At this time, you are not being asked to quarantine yourself however, if you have COVID-19 symptoms, contact your healthcare provider.
At this time, no cruise travel is advised by the CDC, especially for those with underlying health conditions: https://wwwnc.cdc.gov/travel/page/covid-19-cruise-ship

hr.p: Note: Because this changes quickly, verify travel destinations closer to the time of departure. Different countries in Europe were added to Level 3 after the State came out with their guidance: https://wwwnc.cdc.gov/travel/notices/warning/coronavirus-europe
As a district, we will continue to monitor the situation and update you as we receive more information from the different health agencies.
